intro: Aconitum × cammarum var. ramosum, commonly known as the Alpine garden aconite, is a hybrid perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems that bear clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in cool, moist environments and prefers well-drained soil. Due to its toxic properties, it should be handled with care.
